body: PHP code hasn't changed at all since 1.2.0. Hopefully these timeout are transient issues

EDIT: This seems to be the first build PHP starts to fail

Build #12267 (Apr 10, 2017 2:47:48 PM)

Ok I narrowed down the regression.

So the PHP tests were passing at this commit: 2dfc3af 4/10 1:09pm PT
And the tests were failing at this commit: 115b4fa 4/10 2:11pm PT

Appears to be related to #10407. That PR moves the `third_party/googletest` and `third_party/protobuf` commit hash and that might be the reason. In particular, for `third_party/protobuf` it goes from the released `3.2.0` tag to an unreleased commit on the `3.3.x` branch.
#10407 is being reverted in #10637. I verified that the PHP interop tests failures are gone in that PR jenkins run.

I am looking at the original issue - ping_pong fails with PHP as client. I narrowed it down to the fact that the PHP client is stuck at the first `read()`  (that's after the first `write()` being successful).

Here's the trace (the last `grpc_completion_queue_pluck` just hangs)

Then it's just between `TIMER CHECK BEGIN` and `TIMER CHECK END`
Again, if I just re-compile protobuf at 3.2.0 the ping_pong error does not reproduce.
@sreecha may this also be related to the things you've been looking at lately?

The PHP interop tests errors are gone after #10688 was merged, because the `third_party/protobuf` commit was reverted back to 3.2.0. Removing the Release Blocker tag.

When we do roll forward to protobuf 3.3.0, we will have to pay very close eye again on this.
This failure seems to still be present in 1.3.x. See https://grpc-testing.appspot.com/job/gRPC_interop_pull_requests/13464/ and https://grpc-testing.appspot.com/job/gRPC_interop_pull_requests/13477/

Probably timing. The same fix (#10735) only got merged into `v1.3.x` 13 hours ago (4/19 9:11pm). The two PR jenkins run above were before that time. A more recent one like this: https://grpc-testing.appspot.com/job/gRPC_interop_pull_requests/13488/#showFailuresLink seems fine
